events.name: Severe flooding in Sumatra, Indonesia, January 2022
events.wd_label: Severe flooding in Sumatra, Indonesia, January 2022
events.wd_description: Torrential rains in Sumatra, Indonesia, caused severe flooding, displacing over 30,000 people and leading to the deaths of two children, with significant damage to crops and concerns about a potential COVID-19 spike.
events.description: Torrential rains in Sumatra, Indonesia, caused severe flooding, displacing over 30,000 people and leading to the deaths of two children, with significant damage to crops and concerns about a potential COVID-19 spike.

events.name: Flooding in Aceh and surrounding provinces
events.wd_label: Flooding in Aceh and surrounding provinces
events.wd_description: Heavy rain led to flooding in Aceh and surrounding provinces, submerging villages and towns, with Hatta's village underwater since the start of the year, and over 30,000 people displaced.
events.description: Heavy rain led to flooding in Aceh and surrounding provinces, submerging villages and towns, with Hatta's village underwater since the start of the year, and over 30,000 people displaced.

events.name: Impact on local economy and health
events.wd_label: Impact on local economy and health
events.wd_description: The flooding destroyed rice crops and disrupted day laborers, devastating the local economy, while fears grow of a rise in respiratory illnesses and a potential COVID-19 spike due to crowded shelters.
events.description: The flooding destroyed rice crops and disrupted day laborers, devastating the local economy, while fears grow of a rise in respiratory illnesses and a potential COVID-19 spike due to crowded shelters.

events.name: Response and mitigation efforts
events.wd_description: Local authorities declared a state of emergency, providing aid such as food and blankets, while planning for long-term solutions like the Keureuto Dam to prevent future flooding.
events.description: Local authorities declared a state of emergency, providing aid such as food and blankets, while planning for long-term solutions like the Keureuto Dam to prevent future flooding.

events.name: Potential Russian Invasion of Ukraine
events.wd_description: Tensions rise as US President Joe Biden warns of a potential Russian invasion of Ukraine, with a build-up of Russian troops on the Ukrainian border and diplomatic efforts to de-escalate the situation.
events.description: Tensions rise as US President Joe Biden warns of a potential Russian invasion of Ukraine, with a build-up of Russian troops on the Ukrainian border and diplomatic efforts to de-escalate the situation.

events.name: US warnings
events.wd_description: US President Joe Biden and officials warn of a distinct possibility of a Russian invasion of Ukraine in February.
events.description: US President Joe Biden and officials warn of a distinct possibility of a Russian invasion of Ukraine in February.

events.name: t: Biden's statements
events.wd_description: President Biden warns of a potential Russian invasion during a phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.
events.description: President Biden warns of a potential Russian invasion during a phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

events.name: t: White House statement
events.wd_description: The White House issues a statement reaffirming the US's readiness to respond decisively if Russia invades Ukraine.
events.description: The White House issues a statement reaffirming the US's readiness to respond decisively if Russia invades Ukraine.

events.name: t: National Security Council spokesperson
events.wd_description: Emily Horne, spokesperson for the National Security Council, reiterates Biden's warning of a possible invasion.
events.description: Emily Horne, spokesperson for the National Security Council, reiterates Biden's warning of a possible invasion.

events.name: Russian troop build-up
events.wd_description: Tens of thousands of Russian troops are positioned on Ukraine's borders, raising fears of an imminent invasion.
events.description: Tens of thousands of Russian troops are positioned on Ukraine's borders, raising fears of an imminent invasion.

events.name: diplomatic efforts
events.wd_description: Diplomatic efforts are underway to de-escalate the situation, including talks between the US, Ukraine, and European leaders.
events.description: Diplomatic efforts are underway to de-escalate the situation, including talks between the US, Ukraine, and European leaders.

events.name: t: Biden-Zelensky call
events.wd_description: President Biden and President Zelensky discuss joint actions for the future and recent diplomatic efforts to de-escalate the crisis.
events.description: President Biden and President Zelensky discuss joint actions for the future and recent diplomatic efforts to de-escalate the crisis.

events.name: t: Macron-Putin call
events.wd_description: French President Emmanuel Macron is scheduled to speak with Russian President Vladimir Putin to discuss the crisis.
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron is scheduled to speak with Russian President Vladimir Putin to discuss the crisis.

events.name: t: US-Russia negotiations
events.wd_description: Ongoing negotiations between the US and Russia, including the rejection of Russia's demand that Ukraine never join NATO.
events.description: Ongoing negotiations between the US and Russia, including the rejection of Russia's demand that Ukraine never join NATO.

events.name: energy implications
events.wd_description: The potential invasion has significant implications for energy projects, including the Nord Stream 2 pipeline from Russia to Germany.
events.description: The potential invasion has significant implications for energy projects, including the Nord Stream 2 pipeline from Russia to Germany.

events.name: t: Nord Stream 2 project
events.wd_description: The Nord Stream 2 pipeline, designed to double Russia's gas exports to Germany, faces potential sanctions if Russia invades Ukraine.
events.description: The Nord Stream 2 pipeline, designed to double Russia's gas exports to Germany, faces potential sanctions if Russia invades Ukraine.

events.name: t: potential sanctions
events.wd_description: Western allies, including the US and Germany, threaten to target Russia's economy and energy projects with sanctions if an invasion occurs.
events.description: Western allies, including the US and Germany, threaten to target Russia's economy and energy projects with sanctions if an invasion occurs.

events.name: Sudan Protests and Military Coup Impact
events.wd_label: Sudan Protests and Military Coup Impact
events.wd_description: The military coup in Sudan and subsequent protests have led to widespread violence, economic disruption, and a struggle for power between the military and pro-democracy protesters.
events.description: The military coup in Sudan and subsequent protests have led to widespread violence, economic disruption, and a struggle for power between the military and pro-democracy protesters.

events.name: Military Coup
events.wd_description: The military seized power in Sudan, disrupting a power-sharing agreement with a civilian coalition and leading to widespread unrest and protests.
events.description: The military seized power in Sudan, disrupting a power-sharing agreement with a civilian coalition and leading to widespread unrest and protests.

events.name: t: Seizure of Power
events.wd_description: The military seized control in Sudan in October, ending the power-sharing agreement with the civilian coalition.
events.description: The military seized control in Sudan in October, ending the power-sharing agreement with the civilian coalition.

events.name: t: Power-Sharing Agreement Disruption
events.wd_description: The military coup disrupted a power-sharing agreement that had been in place for over two years, leading to political instability.
events.description: The military coup disrupted a power-sharing agreement that had been in place for over two years, leading to political instability.

events.name: Protests and Violence
events.wd_description: Protests erupted across Sudan in response to the military coup, leading to violent clashes between protesters and security forces, resulting in numerous deaths and injuries.
events.description: Protests erupted across Sudan in response to the military coup, leading to violent clashes between protesters and security forces, resulting in numerous deaths and injuries.

events.name: t: Protests Against Coup
events.wd_description: Protests broke out across Sudan as civilians opposed the military coup and demanded a return to civilian rule.
events.description: Protests broke out across Sudan as civilians opposed the military coup and demanded a return to civilian rule.

events.name: t: Security Force Violence
events.wd_description: Security forces responded to the protests with violence, opening fire on demonstrators and leading to multiple fatalities.
events.description: Security forces responded to the protests with violence, opening fire on demonstrators and leading to multiple fatalities.

events.name: t: Casualties and Injuries
events.wd_description: The violent crackdown by security forces resulted in the deaths of more than 70 protesters and thousands of injuries.
events.description: The violent crackdown by security forces resulted in the deaths of more than 70 protesters and thousands of injuries.

events.name: Economic and Political Impact
events.wd_description: The military coup and subsequent unrest have had significant economic and political repercussions, including the resignation of Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok and the reinstatement of Bashir loyalists.
events.description: The military coup and subsequent unrest have had significant economic and political repercussions, including the resignation of Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok and the reinstatement of Bashir loyalists.

events.name: t: Economic Crisis
events.wd_description: The economic gains made during the power-sharing transition have been forfeited, exacerbating the economic crisis in Sudan.
events.description: The economic gains made during the power-sharing transition have been forfeited, exacerbating the economic crisis in Sudan.

events.name: t: Political Instability
events.wd_description: The coup has led to significant political instability, with ongoing power struggles between the military and pro-democracy protesters.
events.description: The coup has led to significant political instability, with ongoing power struggles between the military and pro-democracy protesters.

events.name: t: Resignation of PM
events.wd_description: Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok resigned after realizing he could not work without political backing, further deepening the political crisis.
events.description: Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok resigned after realizing he could not work without political backing, further deepening the political crisis.

events.name: t: Reinstatement of Loyalists
events.wd_description: The military ruler Gen Abdel Fattah al-Burhan appointed a caretaker administration that includes Bashir loyalists to steer the country to elections.
events.description: The military ruler Gen Abdel Fattah al-Burhan appointed a caretaker administration that includes Bashir loyalists to steer the country to elections.

events.name: International Response
events.wd_description: The international community, including the UN and the Friends of Sudan group, has been involved in diplomatic efforts to resolve the crisis, but with limited success and varying levels of faith from Sudanese protesters.
events.description: The international community, including the UN and the Friends of Sudan group, has been involved in diplomatic efforts to resolve the crisis, but with limited success and varying levels of faith from Sudanese protesters.

events.name: t: Diplomatic Efforts
events.wd_description: The UN and the Friends of Sudan, which includes the US, UK, European states, and junta allies Saudi Arabia and the UAE, have been engaged in efforts to find a solution to the crisis.
events.description: The UN and the Friends of Sudan, which includes the US, UK, European states, and junta allies Saudi Arabia and the UAE, have been engaged in efforts to find a solution to the crisis.

events.name: t: Protests' View on International Response
events.wd_label: t: Protests' View on International Response
events.wd_description: Many Sudanese protesters have little faith in the international efforts, feeling that the military should have no role in the government.
events.description: Many Sudanese protesters have little faith in the international efforts, feeling that the military should have no role in the government.

events.name: U.S. EV Battery Supply Chain Development
events.wd_label: U.S. EV Battery Supply Chain Development
events.wd_description: The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) is advancing battery capabilities to transform the energy landscape and transportation sector by powering electric vehicles and storing clean energy, with initiatives like the Battery500 Consortium and partnerships aimed at reducing battery costs and enhancing infrastructure.
events.description: The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) is advancing battery capabilities to transform the energy landscape and transportation sector by powering electric vehicles and storing clean energy, with initiatives like the Battery500 Consortium and partnerships aimed at reducing battery costs and enhancing infrastructure.

events.name: Battery500 Consortium
events.wd_description: The Battery500 Consortium, launched in 2017, is focused on increasing lithium battery cell energy to 500 Wh/kg, lowering EV battery costs, and advancing cell design, manufacturing, and testing tools.
events.description: The Battery500 Consortium, launched in 2017, is focused on increasing lithium battery cell energy to 500 Wh/kg, lowering EV battery costs, and advancing cell design, manufacturing, and testing tools.

events.name: t: Consortium Members
events.wd_description: The consortium includes national labs, universities, and industry partners, including Nobel Prize winners, focused on developing advanced EV battery technologies.
events.description: The consortium includes national labs, universities, and industry partners, including Nobel Prize winners, focused on developing advanced EV battery technologies.

events.name: t: Research and Development Goals
events.wd_description: The goal is to increase lithium battery cell energy to 500 Wh/kg from 220 Wh/kg, reducing costs and material requirements while improving energy density.
events.description: The goal is to increase lithium battery cell energy to 500 Wh/kg from 220 Wh/kg, reducing costs and material requirements while improving energy density.

events.name: t: Funding and Industry Collaboration
events.wd_description: Battery500 received an additional $75 million from DOE and increased collaboration with industry, including funding from General Motors to build prototype cells.
events.description: Battery500 received an additional $75 million from DOE and increased collaboration with industry, including funding from General Motors to build prototype cells.

events.name: DOE Funding Initiatives
events.wd_description: DOE awarded $134 million to 25 national lab projects to reduce battery cost and size, enable fast charging, and address impacts on the electric grid.
events.description: DOE awarded $134 million to 25 national lab projects to reduce battery cost and size, enable fast charging, and address impacts on the electric grid.

events.name: t: National Lab Projects
events.wd_description: DOE funded 25 national lab projects with $134 million to advance EV battery technologies and address various challenges in the industry.
events.description: DOE funded 25 national lab projects with $134 million to advance EV battery technologies and address various challenges in the industry.

events.name: t: Fast Charging Development
events.wd_description: Some projects focus on enabling batteries to be fully charged in less than 15 minutes to support widespread EV adoption.
events.description: Some projects focus on enabling batteries to be fully charged in less than 15 minutes to support widespread EV adoption.

events.name: t: Grid Impact Mitigation
events.wd_description: Projects are working on mitigating impacts of increased EV charging on the electric grid and improving vehicle-to-vehicle communications and controls.
events.description: Projects are working on mitigating impacts of increased EV charging on the electric grid and improving vehicle-to-vehicle communications and controls.

events.name: Domestic Supply Chain Development
events.wd_description: DOE aims to ensure a strong domestic supply chain for EV battery production through partnerships like Li-Bridge, which bridges gaps in the supply chain and works towards the 2030 goals in the National Blueprint for Lithium Batteries.
events.description: DOE aims to ensure a strong domestic supply chain for EV battery production through partnerships like Li-Bridge, which bridges gaps in the supply chain and works towards the 2030 goals in the National Blueprint for Lithium Batteries.

events.name: t: Li-Bridge Partnership
events.wd_description: Li-Bridge is a public-private partnership that helps bridge gaps in the domestic lithium battery supply chain and collaborates with national labs.
events.description: Li-Bridge is a public-private partnership that helps bridge gaps in the domestic lithium battery supply chain and collaborates with national labs.

events.name: t: National Blueprint Goals
events.wd_description: The partnership works towards the 2030 goals in the National Blueprint for Lithium Batteries to establish a secure supply chain in the U.S.
events.description: The partnership works towards the 2030 goals in the National Blueprint for Lithium Batteries to establish a secure supply chain in the U.S.

events.name: EV Infrastructure Development
events.wd_description: The Joint Office of Energy and Transportation, a collaboration between DOE and DOT, focuses on implementing EV infrastructure nationwide, aiming to deploy 500,000 charging stations by 2030 and reduce emissions.
events.description: The Joint Office of Energy and Transportation, a collaboration between DOE and DOT, focuses on implementing EV infrastructure nationwide, aiming to deploy 500,000 charging stations by 2030 and reduce emissions.

events.name: t: Technical Assistance
events.wd_description: The Joint Office will provide technical assistance to deploy, operate, and maintain electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE) and hydrogen fueling infrastructure.
events.description: The Joint Office will provide technical assistance to deploy, operate, and maintain electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE) and hydrogen fueling infrastructure.

events.name: t: Data Sharing
events.wd_description: The office will facilitate data sharing to inform the build-out of EVSE and hydrogen fueling infrastructure.
events.description: The office will facilitate data sharing to inform the build-out of EVSE and hydrogen fueling infrastructure.

events.name: t: Workforce Training
events.wd_description: New training and certification programs will be developed for the workforce responsible for installing, maintaining, and repairing EVSE.
events.description: New training and certification programs will be developed for the workforce responsible for installing, maintaining, and repairing EVSE.

events.name: t: Two-Way Electricity Distribution
events.wd_description: Infrastructure will be developed to allow two-way electricity distribution, enabling power flow between vehicles and the grid.
events.description: Infrastructure will be developed to allow two-way electricity distribution, enabling power flow between vehicles and the grid.

events.name: t: Interagency Collaboration
events.wd_description: DOE will work with DOT, EPA, and HUD to develop a joint strategy to decarbonize transportation and make it affordable and accessible.
events.description: DOE will work with DOT, EPA, and HUD to develop a joint strategy to decarbonize transportation and make it affordable and accessible.
